meanings.definition: Of or relating to the measurement of refractive power
meanings.sent1: The dioptral scale helps optometrists determine the strength of lenses needed.
meanings.sent2: Her glasses were specially made with a dioptral adjustment for her astigmatism.
meanings.sent3: The dioptral calculations were so precise that even the light seemed clearer through the lens.
meanings.sent4: His dioptral vision of the world was sharp and focused, never missing any details.
meanings.sent5: The dioptral analysis of the eye's curvature was crucial for the accurate prescription of glasses.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement for the refractive power of a lens or optical system
meanings.sent1: The lens had a dioptral value of -2.5, correcting his nearsightedness effectively.
meanings.sent2: Opticians use the dioptral scale to determine the strength of lenses for patients.
meanings.sent3: The telescope's dioptral rating was so high that it could see distant galaxies clearly.
meanings.sent4: Her eyesight was like a camera with adjustable dioptral settings, focusing perfectly every time.
meanings.sent5: The binoculars had a dioptral measurement that allowed for crisp, detailed views of birds in the distance.
